Customizing Your GNOME Desktop Using the Control Center
You use the Control Center to configure the characteristics of your desktop. The configuration of each aspect of the desktop is controlled by a dedicated software tool called a capplet. For convenience, these capplets are grouped in the Control Center under the following headings:
Main
Advanced
Sawfish
To display the Control Center window, open the Main Menu then choose Programs Settings GNOME Control Center.
Select a heading from the left side of the Control Center window. The capplets are displayed on the right side of the window. To open a capplet, double-click on the capplet. A capplet dialog is displayed. Each capplet contains the following action buttons at the bottom of the dialog:
The OK button.
The OK button is only active when you make a change in a capplet. Click OK to implement the changes you make, and to save the current settings.
The Cancel button.
Click on the Cancel button to remove any changes you make, and to close the capplet dialog.
Some capplets contain an Apply button instead of an OK button. For example, the Keyboard , Mouse, and Sound capplets contain an Apply button. Click Apply to implement the changes you make, and to save the current settings. The File Types and Programs capplet only contains a Close button. When you make changes in the File Types and Programs capplet, the changes are implemented and saved immediately.
